alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 9:19AM CST until February 07 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...Georgia...Florida... Chattahoochee River at Columbia L&D affecting Early, Houston, Jackson and Seminole Counties. For the Chattahoochee River...including Columbia L&D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at Columbia L&D. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 108.0 feet, Low lying areas begin to flood along Omussee Creek in Houston County from Lizard Landing Camp to the Chattahoochee River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Sunday /9:00 AM EST Sunday/ the stage was 106.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CST Sunday /9:00 AM EST Sunday/ was 106.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 107.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 94.8 feet with further reductions to 85.0 feet by the end of the upcoming week. - Flood stage is 106.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 106.6 feet on 04/20/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
